meanings.definition: Administer an anaesthetic to (a person or animal) to induce a state of insensitivity to pain.
meanings.sent1: The dentist will anaesthetise my gums before filling the cavity.
meanings.sent2: The doctor will anaesthetise the patient before the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy bear asked the vet to anaesthetise its paw for a painless injection.
meanings.sent4: The magician's words seemed to anaesthetise the audience, making them forget their worries.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music had the power to anaesthetise my mind, easing all discomfort.

meanings.definition: Cause to be insensitive or numb.
meanings.sent1: The cold weather can anaesthetise your fingers if you're not wearing gloves.
meanings.sent2: The strong medication can anaesthetise the area and reduce the pain.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie had such a surprising ending that it anaesthetised my emotions.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous routine can anaesthetise your spirit, making you feel dull.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view seemed to anaesthetise my senses, leaving me in awe.
